metadata.title: CVE-2021-43537 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect type conversion of sizes from 64bit to 32bit integers allowedan attacker to corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, andFirefox < 95.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
